First I need to install the bio3d packages in the console.
```{r}
library(bio3d)

s1 <- read.pdb("4AKE") # kinase with drug
s2 <- read.pdb("1AKE") # kinase no drug
s3 <- read.pdb("1E4Y") # kinase with drug

#input of the function is a read.pdb file/protein of choice
#the function takes in a protein pdb file and the output of the function is the plotted version using parameters of the trimmed PDB file and #atom$b command.

plot <- function (x)
{
  plotb3(trim.pdb(x, chain="A", elety="CA")$atom$b, sse= trim.pdb(x, chain = "A", elety="CA"), typ="l", ylab="Bfactor")
}

plot(s1)
plot(s2)
plot(s3)

```
